title: Dragon Caused the Lightning Strike
description: The most popular fan theory suggests that the lightning bolt that saved Luffy from Buggy's execution was not divine intervention or coincidence, but was actually caused by Monkey D. Dragon using weather-controlling abilities. This theory is supported by Dragon's later appearance where he uses wind powers and by the mysterious storm that appears in Loguetown.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Dragon appears in Loguetown during the same storm that produced the lightning
Dragon demonstrates wind/weather powers later in the episode
Smoker later comments 'that explains what happened at Loguetown' when he learns Dragon is Luffy's father
Recent anime openings juxtapose Dragon with the lightning strike scene
counterEvidence: Dragon's exact powers have never been confirmed in the series
The lightning could be a manifestation of Luffy's incredible luck or the 'Will of D'

title: Dragon Has the Wind-Wind Fruit (Kaze Kaze no Mi)
description: Building on the weather theory, many fans believe Dragon possesses a Logia-type Wind-Wind Fruit that gives him control over wind and possibly broader weather manipulation. This would explain his association with storms, his ability to fly, and the wind that stopped Smoker.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Dragon uses wind to stop Smoker in this episode
Every Dragon appearance is accompanied by strong winds or storms
A wind-based Logia fruit would be incredibly powerful and fitting for a revolutionary leader
Wind can disperse Smoker's smoke, establishing a tactical advantage
counterEvidence: No Wind-Wind Fruit has been officially confirmed to exist
Dragon's powers have never been explicitly revealed even 1000+ episodes later
Alternative theories suggest a Mythical Zoan fruit instead

title: Dragon Has a Mythical Zoan: Model Kui (Chinese Rain God)
description: An alternative theory proposes that Dragon possesses a Mythical Zoan Devil Fruit based on Kui, a figure from Chinese mythology that represents a Monkey-Dragon rain god. This would explain his storm-related appearances and connect to the Monkey D. family name.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Kui is a Monkey-Dragon figure in Chinese mythology, matching Dragon's name and appearance
Kui is associated with storms, thunder, and rain in mythology
Mythical Zoans are often connected to legendary figures, fitting Dragon's importance
The theory explains both the lightning and Dragon's powers
counterEvidence: Highly speculative with limited direct evidence
Dragon's exact form and abilities remain mysterious
Chinese mythology connection is not confirmed in One Piece

title: The Lightning Was Divine Intervention/Luck
description: Some fans theorize that the lightning strike was not caused by any individual but was instead genuine divine intervention, the 'Will of D,' or Luffy's incredible luck protecting him at a crucial moment. This interpretation takes Sanji's comment literally.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Sanji explicitly calls it 'divine intervention'
Luffy has demonstrated incredible luck throughout the series
The 'Will of D' may protect certain individuals at crucial moments
Keeps the mystery and supernatural elements of the series alive
counterEvidence: Dragon's immediate appearance and use of wind suggests a connection
The timing is too perfect to be pure coincidence
Smoker's later comment suggests Dragon's involvement

title: Dragon Doesn't Have a Devil Fruit
description: A minority theory suggests Dragon might not have a Devil Fruit at all, instead using advanced techniques or technology to create weather effects. This would parallel other powerful non-Devil Fruit users like Shanks, Mihawk, and Garp.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Some of the most powerful characters in One Piece don't use Devil Fruits
Dragon's father Garp is incredibly powerful without a Devil Fruit
Would make Dragon even more impressive if he leads the Revolutionary Army without fruit powers
counterEvidence: Dragon clearly demonstrates some form of supernatural weather control
The wind effects appear too powerful and consistent to be natural or technological
Most evidence points toward Devil Fruit abilities

title: Luffy and Roger Share the Same Destiny
description: The parallel between Luffy smiling on the execution platform and Roger's execution 22 years earlier suggests that Luffy is following the same path as Roger and may inherit his role as the catalyst for a new era. Some fans theorize Luffy will eventually discover the One Piece and follow Roger's legacy.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Luffy and Roger smile in the exact same way facing death
Both inspire others through their fearlessness
Smoker explicitly recognizes the parallel
Both bear the Will of D
counterEvidence: Luffy may forge his own unique path rather than simply repeating Roger's
The series emphasizes individual dreams and choices
